oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. William Burton to his parents
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. William Burton, Co. F, 2nd Ky. Cav., USA, wrote that he was in good health upon returning from scout duties. He had been down the McMinnville and Shelbyville railroad, "burnt several bridges and a trane of cars and burnt two stations on the road and captured about 250 persons." In McMinnville, they "captured a heap of bacon and wagon."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
